page.title: 01LANDSCAPE:A GENERAL DESCRIP.
page.content:
{
The area covered by the grid is made up mainly of well cultivated grassland crisscrossed by narrow country lanes with the high hedges associated with the Devon countryside. The main A39 Trunk road passing through the area connects North Devon's two most important towns and is subsequently very busy, especially in summer as the surrounding area relies heavily on tourism. A ribbon development of housing has taken place along this road consisting mainly of post war properties. The farms and hamlets are much older. The area lies adjacent to the low lying area of the River Taw but rises steeply to over 400 feet with many steep sided valleys.{
